name: Big Shots: Confessions of a Campus Bookie [DVD] [2002]
longDescription: Based on a real-life 1994 scandal involving college basketball point-shaving, Big Shot: Confessions of a Campus Bookie stars David Krumholtz as the title character. Though a mere freshman on the campus of Arizona State University, Benny Silman (Krumholtz) is in charge of accepting all bets for the school's basketball games, under the watchful eye of his mentor, a high-rolling Las Vegas gambler (Nicholas Turturro). It isn't long before Benny is operating his own bookie ring, raking in big bucks at every turn. The beginning of the end for Benny occurs when A.S.U. basketball star Stevin "Hedake" Smith (Tory Kittles) suggests that he'd like a piece of the action, too. Although the Benny Silman depicted onscreen remains unrepentant and unapologetic, even when getting his just desserts at the hands of the authorities, the real Silman appears in the film's epilogue, equipped with an unexpected "Don't let this happen to you!" admonition. Filmed on location in California and Nevada (not surprisingly, the producers were unable to line up shooting dates in Arizona), the made-for-cable Big Shot: Confessions of a Campus Bookie debuted March 31, 2002 over the FX network.

name: Heist [DVD] [2001]
longDescription: Twists and turns abound in the David Mamet thriller Heist. Sporting a solid 1.85:1 anamorphic widescreen transfer, Warner Bros. has done a nice job making sure this image is clear of any excessive hindrances or imperfections. The colors all look bright and bustling with the black levels spot-on. The audio is presented in Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround in English and French. This Dolby 5.1 soundtrack is mixed very evenly, though it is mainly filtered through the front and center speakers. While this soundtrack may not be as aggressive or bombastic as other action movies, it is engagingly crisp with Mamet's unique brand of dialogue. Also included on this disc are English, French, and Spanish subtitles. Sadly, the only extra features to be found on this disc are a few measly filmographies on the cast and crew, plus a single theatrical trailer for the film.

name: Bad News Bears in Breaking Training [DVD] [1977]
longDescription: Michael Pressman's follow-up to Michael Ritchie's outstanding The Bad News Bears, The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training, comes to DVD with a widescreen anamorphic transfer that preserves the original theatrical aspect ratio of 1.85:1. name: LEGO - Creator Majestic Tiger 31129
longDescription: Passionate animal fans aged 9+ will love to play out fun stories with this brilliant LEGO Creator 3in1 Majestic Tiger (31129). They can build a posable tiger with a red bird, rebuild it into a posable red panda with bamboo and a bonsai tree, turn it into a koi fish with moving tail and fins and water lilies, or delve into their imaginations to create another animal. A digital experience for LEGO builders The building set comes with interactive digital building instructions to make the building experience even more fun. Available in the free LEGO Building Instructions app for use on smartphones and tablets, the zoom and rotate tools help kids visualize the model as they build.
